* Prepare the vaccine according to the manufacturer's instructions (e.g., mixing multidose vials,-).

Administration

	+ For adults, other injections typically take place in the deltoid muscle of the upper arm (typically the non-dominant arm).

Site Selection and Preparation

* Choose an appropriate injection site (deltoid muscle of the upper arm), depending on the patient's age and size.

Administration

* Have the patient sit comfortably in a chair with their arm at a 90-degree angle to facilitate easy access to the injection site.

Equipment and Supplies

Cleanliness and Disinfection

Administration Site Selection

* Choose an administration site based on the patient's age and body mass index (BMI):
	+ Deltoid muscle of the upper arm (typically for adults and children > 3 years old)
	+ Anterolateral thigh (for infants and young children < 3 years old)
* Ensure the skin at the administration site is clean and dry.
III.

Vaccine Administration

* Hold the syringe at a 90-degree angle to the injection site.

Vaccine Administration

* Hold the syringe at a 90-degree angle to the skin.

Vaccine Administration

* Use a sterile needle and syringe to draw up the correct dose of flu vaccine from the prepared vial or prefilled syringe.

Vaccine Administration

* Identify the correct dose and strength of the vaccine according to the patient's age group:
	+ Typically 0.5 mL for adults and children > 3 years old 
	+ 0.25 mL for children 6-35 months old (flu vaccine designed for this age group)
* Remove the needle cap and hold the syringe at a 90-degree angle to the injection site.
* Insert the needle perpendicular to the skin, using a quick and gentle motion.
